Record.ClassificationPath: Bacterial Infections and Mycoses/Bacterial Infections/Gram-Positive Bacterial Infections/Actinomycetales Infections/Mycobacterium Infections/Leprosy
Record.Description: A chronic granulomatous infection caused by MYCOBACTERIUM LEPRAE. The granulomatous lesions are manifested in the skin, the mucous membranes, and the peripheral nerves. Two polar or principal types are lepromatous and tuberculoid.
